bug.author: Pierrolo
bug.description:
Hi I downloaded the NH environment from your binaries, but it doesn't work. At the start, I choose multirotor ,so I click "No" and then it displays the following: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23744690/38857597-f5d7b234-4229-11e8-88f0-d676b2bafa89.png></denchmark-link>
and then : <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23744690/38857623-05727eb8-422a-11e8-9ff3-d5a1063b779b.png></denchmark-link>
I tried launching it on two different computers and I get the same error. I also tried to run the latest ZhangJiaJie, and the same error poped up. Those same error also happen when I try to select the car. My belief is that, 5 days ago there were a few changes made, clockspeed for example, that made the build and the binaries not work. Then it got fixed for the build, but I don't think the binaries were updated... Thanks

comments.comment: I am having this same problem. But my city environment just worked fine. Having problems with NH and Africa binaries. Any solution so far?
Hi, I just downloaded the city env, and got the same problem personnaly.
prerelease is broken for us too.
City environment is fine in car mode, but drone mode is broken down.
The same question. However the in the previous version, NH can work
Thanks for reporting the problem. I've updated the binaries for release 1.1.10 so it should work now.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sytelus>@sytelus</denchmark-link> I still met the similar problem in 1.1.10, with pop up box becoming" error at start up: error creating directiories, hr=5" , how can i solve this, please? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29434082/41197543-e9ad1568-6c94-11e8-8d2a-a866a1154c5f.png></denchmark-link>
and click "OK" and then <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29434082/41197544-09656c2a-6c95-11e8-8b53-4600d82ac604.png></denchmark-link>
the same thing also happened to landscapemountain and zhangjiajie, not test others yet

as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vinbo>@vinbo</denchmark-link> 's issue is separate from the problem listed in this thread, let's track it in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/AirSim/issues/1150>#1150</denchmark-link>
The issue in this thread should be solved with the current binary releases.
